newsitem.title: USA: SoftKey signs new distributor pacts in Asia.
newsitem.headline: SoftKey signs new distributor pacts in Asia.

text.p: SoftKey International Inc., a leading provider of educational computer software, said Monday it signed multimillion-dollar agreements for the distribution of its products in South Korea, Taiwan and eventually China.

SoftKey, creator of educational software ranging from the Reader Rabbit series for pre-school children to preparation programmes for college entrance exams, said it signed exclusive distribution agreements with Daekyo Computer Systems Co. Ltd. of South Korea and MiTac Inc. of Taiwan.
Financial terms of the agreements were not disclosed.
"These two exclusive agreements should give SoftKey a substantial foothold in Pacific Rim markets," said David Patrick, president of SoftKey's International Division.
Under the agreements, SoftKey's products will be made and sold in South Korea and Taiwan. SoftKey's units include the Learning Co., MECC and Compton's.
SoftKey, which is based in Cambridge, Mass., said the new distributor partnerships will focus on adapting SoftKey products to correspond with regional teaching methods and to reflect local cultures.
"In addition to distributing the English-language versions of our programmes, we will be translating SoftKey's award-winning educational products into the local languages," Patrick said.
A leader in multimedia education in Korea, Daekyo Computer Systems is part of Daekyo Group, which has interests in trade, broadcast, publishing, computer distribution and education.

SoftKey said its products will be distributed through Daekyo's extensive network of consumer retail and educational outlets, and its correspondence-education business, which boasts more than 1.5 million members.
MiTac's distribution network covers consumer retail and educational outlets throughout Taiwan. It is developing a similar infrastructure in China.
SoftKey's stock added 50 cents to $21.125 in late trading on the Nasdaq market.
